notes:
1. Concept

Present Worth (PW), also known as Present Value (PV), is the current value of a future sum of money or stream of cash flows, given a specified rate of return. Present worth analysis is one of the most common methods for comparing investment alternatives. It brings all future costs and revenues back to a single equivalent value at time zero.

2. Key Formulas (Interest Factors)

The formulas are often expressed using standard factor notation, where (X/Y, i, n) means "Find X, given Y, at interest rate i for n periods".

  • Find P, given F (Single Payment Present Worth Factor, P/F):
    This calculates the present value of a single future amount. $$ P = F(1+i)^{-n} = F(P/F, i, n)$$
  • Find P, given A (Uniform Series Present Worth Factor, P/A):
    This calculates the present value of a uniform series of payments (annuity). $$ P = A \left[ \frac{(1+i)^n - 1}{i(1+i)^n} \right] = A(P/A, i, n)$$

solvedExamples.question: What is the present worth of $10,000 to be received 8 years from now, if the interest rate is 6% per year? The (P/F, 6%, 8) factor is 0.6274.
solvedExamples.explanation: We need to find the present worth (P) of a future sum (F). We use the P/F factor. $P = F(P/F, i, n) = $10,000(0.6274) = $6,274$.

solvedExamples.question: A project will generate a net revenue of $5,000 per year for 10 years. What is the present worth of this revenue stream if the interest rate is 8%? The (P/A, 8%, 10) factor is 6.7101.
solvedExamples.explanation: We need to find the present worth (P) of an annual series of payments (A). We use the P/A factor. $P = A(P/A, i, n) = $5,000(6.7101) = $33,550.50$.
